metadata.title: CVE-2024-0639 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A denial of service vulnerability due to a deadlock was found insctp_auto_asconf_init in net/sctp/socket.c in the Linux kernelâ€™s SCTPsubsystem. This flaw allows guests with local user privileges to trigger adeadlock and potentially crash the system.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-0639` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.15.0-86-generic - 5.15.0-86.96
linux-image-5.15.0-86-generic-lpae - 5.15.0-86.96
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-86-generic - 5.15.0-86.96
linux-image-unsigned-5.15.0-86-generic-64k - 5.15.0-86.96
No subscription required

linux-image-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-14-generic - 6.5.0-14.14~22.04.1

No subscription required
